com.metreeca.rdf.formats

Class RDFFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.rest.Format<Collection<Statement>>
      • com.metreeca.rdf.formats.RDFFormat

  • public final class RDFFormat
extends Format<Collection<Statement>>
    RDF body format.

    • Field Detail

      • ExternalBase

        public static final String ExternalBase
        Custom header providing the external base for on-demand RDF body rewriting.
        See Also:
        Rewriter, Constant Field Values

      • RDFJSONFormat

        public static final RDFFormat RDFJSONFormat
        The plain JSON file format. The file extension .json is recommend for JSON documents. The media type is application/json. The character encoding is UTF-8.

      • RioFocus

        public static final RioSetting<Resource> RioFocus
        Sets the focus resource for codecs.

        Defaults to null.

      • RioShape

        public static final RioSetting<Shape> RioShape
        Sets the expected shape for the resources handled by codecs.

        Defaults to null.

      • RioContext

        public static final RioSetting<javax.json.JsonObject> RioContext
        Sets the expected JSON-LD context for codecs.

        Defaults to an empty object.

      • path

        public List<IRI> path(String base,
                      Shape shape,
                      String path)
        Description copied from class: Format
        Parses a JSON query field path.

        The default implementation splits paths at dots without further well-formedness checks.

        Overrides:
        path in class Format<Collection<Statement>>
        Parameters:
        base - the base IRI for resolving relative references
        shape - the base shape for the query
        path - the query field path to be parsed; may be empty
        Returns:
        a list of format-specific path steps parsed from path

      • value

        public Object value(String base,
                    Shape shape,
                    javax.json.JsonValue value)
        Description copied from class: Format
        Parses a JSON query field value.

        The default implementation converts JSON values to their native Java representation, using lists of objects for arrays and maps from strings to objects for objects.

        Overrides:
        value in class Format<Collection<Statement>>
        Parameters:
        base - the base IRI for resolving relative references
        shape - the base shape for the query
        value - the query value to be parsed
        Returns:
        a format-specific value parsed from value

      • get

        public Result<Collection<Statement>,Failure> get(Message<?> message)
        Description copied from class: Format
        Retrieves a body representation from a message.

        Processing failure should be reported using the following HTTP status codes:

        • Response.UnsupportedMediaType for missing bodies;
        • Response.BadRequest for malformed bodies, unless a more specific status code is available.

        The default implementation returns a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, unless explicitly overridden.

        Overrides:
        get in class Format<Collection<Statement>>
        Parameters:
        message - the message whose body representation managed by this body format is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the optional RDF body representation of message, as retrieved from its InputFormat representation, if present; a failure reporting RDF processing errors with the Response.BadRequest status, otherwise

      • set

        public <M extends Message<M>> M set(M message,
                                    Collection<Statement> value)
        Configures the OutputFormat representation of message to write the RDF value to the accepted output stream and, unless already defined, sets the Content-Type header to the MIME type of the RDF serialization selected according to the Accept header of the request associated to the message, if one is present, or to "text/turtle", otherwise.
        Overrides:
        set in class Format<Collection<Statement>>
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of message
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be configured to hold a body representation managed by this body format
        value - the body representation being configured for message by this body format
        Returns:
        the configured message
